page.title: 10HOLLINGS HILL FARM CRADLEY
page.content: The farm is mostly dairy with a few cereal crops.The farmhouse is about 200 years old and the old parts are 300 to 400 years old.We went around the farm.The first thing we saw were the calves and they started to suck our hands.When we saw the lambs some of the girls and boys put their fingers in the lambs mouths and they got bitten.They do not keep pigs but they have a pig sty.They have just a few hens and a cockerel which they said woke them up very early in the morning.We went to see the cows being milked.The cows come in and are all lined up in the pens.Then the cups were put on the udders.When the cows had finished being milked the cups shot off and the milk was taken to the dairy.
